verses.verse: (Is. 45:17) In the LORD all the descendants of Israel Shall be justified, and (1 Cor. 1:31) shall glory.’ ”

(Dead Idols and the Living God) Bel (Is. 21:9; Jer. 50:2) bows down, Nebo stoops; Their idols were on the beasts and on the cattle. Your carriages were heavily loaded, (Jer. 10:5) A burden to the weary beast.
They stoop, they bow down together; They could not deliver the burden, (Judg. 18:17, 18, 24; 2 Sam. 5:21; Jer. 48:7; Hos. 10:5, 6) But have themselves gone into captivity.
“Listen to Me, O house of Jacob, And all the remnant of the house of Israel, (Deut. 32:11; Ps. 71:6; Is. 63:9) Who have been upheld by Me from birth, Who have been carried from the womb:
Even to your old age, (Mal. 3:6) I am He, And even to gray hairs (Ps. 48:14) I will carry you! I have made, and I will bear; Even I will carry, and will deliver you.
“To (Is. 40:18, 25) whom will you liken Me, and make Me equal And compare Me, that we should be alike?
(Is. 40:19; 41:6; Jer. 10:4) They lavish gold out of the bag, And weigh silver on the scales; They hire a (Is. 44:12) goldsmith, and he makes it a god; They prostrate themselves, yes, they worship.

(Is. 45:20; 46:1; Jer. 10:5) They bear it on the shoulder, they carry it And set it in its place, and it stands; From its place it shall not move. Though (Is. 45:20) one cries out to it, yet it cannot answer Nor save him out of his trouble.
“Remember this, and show yourselves men; (Is. 44:19) Recall to mind, O you transgressors.
(Deut. 32:7; Is. 42:9; 65:17) Remember the former things of old, For I am God, and (Is. 45:5, 21) there is no other; I am God, and there is none like Me,

(Is. 45:21; 48:3) Declaring the end from the beginning, And from ancient times things that are not yet done, Saying, (Ps. 33:11; Prov. 19:21; 21:30; Is. 14:24; 25:1; Acts 5:39; Heb. 6:17) ‘My counsel shall stand, And I will do all My pleasure,’

Calling a bird of prey (Is. 41:2, 25) from the east, The man (Is. 44:28) who executes My counsel, from a far country. Indeed (Num. 23:19) I have spoken it; I will also bring it to pass. I have purposed it; I will also do it.
“Listen to Me, you (Ps. 76:5; Is. 48:4; Zech. 7:11, 12; Mal. 3:13) stubborn-hearted, ((Rom. 10:3)) Who are far from righteousness:

((Rom. 1:17)) I bring My righteousness near, it shall not be far off; My salvation (Hab. 2:3) shall not linger. And I will place (Is. 62:11; Joel 3:17; (1 Pet. 2:6)) salvation in Zion, For Israel My glory.

(The Humiliation of Babylon) “Come (Jer. 48:18) down and (Is. 3:26) sit in the dust, O virgin daughter of (Is. 14:18-23; Jer. 25:12; 50:1—51:64) Babylon; Sit on the ground without a throne, O daughter of the Chaldeans! For you shall no more be called Tender and delicate.
